type.description: A connectComplete event reports the result of a connect that blocked. A writeComplete event reports the result of a write that blocked. A dataRead event reports bytes that have arrived following a read call that blocked.

resultCode.description: The result code, if the event type is writeComplete. The result code description matches that of writeInfo.bytesWritten.

isFinalEvent.description: Whether this is the final event that this socket will send.

srcId.description: An ID unique to the calling function's context so that events can get routed back to the correct callback.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a socket of the specified type that will connect to the specified remote machine.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of socket to create. Must be tcp or udp.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address of the remote machine.

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: The port of the remote machine.

onEvent.description: This function is called with events that occur during the lifetime of the socket.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when the socket has been created.

socketId.description: The id of the newly created socket.

functions.name: destroy
functions.description: Destroys the socket. Each socket created should be destroyed after use.

functions.name: connect
functions.description: Connects the socket to the remote machine. For UDP sockets, connect is a non-operation but is safe to call.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when the connection attempt is complete.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: Zero if connection was successful, negative otherwise (TODO: document error codes or switch to boolean). Always successful for UDP sockets.

functions.name: disconnect
functions.description: Disconnects the socket. For UDP sockets, disconnect is a non-operation but is safe to call.

functions.name: read
functions.description: Reads data from the given socket.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Delivers data that was available to be read without blocking.

message.description: The data received. Warning: will probably become a blob or other appropriate binary-friendly type.

functions.name: write
functions.description: Writes data on the given socket.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data to write. Warning: will probably become a blob or other appropriate binary-friendly type.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when the first of any of the following happens: the write operation completes without blocking, the write operation blocked before completion (in which case onEvent() will eventually be called with a writeComplete event), or an error occurred.

bytesWritten.description: The number of bytes sent, or a negative error code.

events.name: onEvent
events.description: Used to pass events back to the socket creator.
